column4: I need GLibc2.3. How can I install it on ubuntu? (I can't find it with apt-cache)
glibc 2.3...? the C library, libc6, is always installed by default
it's not version 2.3, it's version 2.7, and you cannot change that
dunno, I get an error with a plugin and everywhere I look it tells me that th eproblem is that I dont have glibc 2.3
well, maybe that plugin was compiled for that version of glibc, however you can't install that (unless you want to break every other program you have, which wants 2.7)
you should find a version of that plugin that's compiled for your Ubuntu release
which plugin would that be anyway?
I wish there was, it's a very, very old and unsupported program :(
mainly, I'm screwed?
perhaps you can find a version of it with libc statically linked...?
I've been googling on that for what... 5 hours... I seriously don't think theres anything more I can do
I'll simply give up I guess
Dapper came with libc6 2.3
you might try using Dapper in a virtual machine, if that's important to you
are you sure there's no source code to compile, either?
dapper hey... Aight I might try that. thx for the help.
bout the source, dunno, I'd have to check for that
with source I could re-make and have it working with newer libc?
sure, you should (unless the source has other problems)
(/dev/hda == physical drive) != (/dev/hda1 == partition with possibly a filesystem on it)
forward to Fezzler1
it's not prohibited but one really should keep it to a bare minimum
yeah I can understand this, but changing nickname is a server thing, not a channel thing. anyway, no need to discuss that ;)
